did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Black and white glass lantern slides depicting prefabricated housing to room interiors and furniture were used by Loper for teaching and research. Some were made commercially and some taken by Cornell photographer Jon Troy.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Loper was New York state's first female extension architect and worked at Cornell from 1946-1967.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Black and white glass lantern slides depicting prefabricated housing to room interiors and furniture were used by Loper for teaching and research. Some were made commercially and some taken by Cornell photographer Jon Troy.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Cornell University.Dept. of Housing and Design.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Ruby Loper slide collection, #23-16-3265. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

emph.ref: Series III. Exhibit Design: The Museum of Modern Art
